pageContent: Almost 90% of patients with metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer have a clinically actionable genetic alteration, according to a recently published study. Among these patients, researchers found that 65% had genetic changes that could be targeted by investigational or FDA-approved drugs currently used for other cancers, leading to new individualized treatment strategies.

metaData.source:
Physical activity and its mechanistic effects on prostate cancer
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/25800589/
